eligibility: Candidates must have a professional teacher training qualification such as D.El.Ed, B.Ed, or B.El.Ed. The minimum qualification is laid down by NCTE and may vary slightly by state. The test is mandatory for teaching positions from Class I to VIII in government schools.
examFrequency: Usually once or twice a year (varies by state)
coursesLinked: Teaching positions in government schools (Class I-VIII)

faqs.question: Is TET mandatory for all teaching jobs in government schools?
faqs.answer: Yes, passing the Teacher Eligibility Test (TET) is a mandatory qualification for appointment as a teacher for classes I to VIII in government schools, as per the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education (RTE) Act and NCTE guidelines.
